name: NPR
text: .@MorningEdition asked how people staying at home are planning to celebrate this Thanksgiving — and got hundreds of responses. Most are limiting gatherings to a handful of family members while gearing up to connect with other relatives virtually. https://t.co/9bXj8QzCxy

name: NPR
text: Germany is extending its current coronavirus lockdown measures through mid-December, Chancellor Angela Merkel said. But for Christmas, some residents will be given some leeway. Members of one household can meet up with 10 people between Dec. 23 to Jan. 1. https://t.co/JYARrpirNh

name: NPR
text:
President Trump refused to say whether he would attend President-elect Biden's inauguration ceremonies — as is tradition. 

And as far as his political future beyond Jan. 20 — Trump also declined to answer. https://t.co/f8QEYKQFVA

name: NPR
text: From our archives: "Time was in America that stores routinely closed on Thanksgiving Day. Folks sent Thanksgiving greeting cards, people donned odd costumes and schools and communities staged elaborate parades and Thanksgiving pageants." https://t.co/KVxd38hG4h

name: NPR
text: In a year of devastating shutdowns, few restaurants can afford to ignore America's big food-centered celebration. Even storied establishments are offering to cater Thanksgiving to go. https://t.co/Tt0zONboz5

name: NPR
text: "As we have repeatedly explained, a threat of death qualifies as past persecution," the Fourth Circuit Court of Appeals said in its decision. https://t.co/H1aNiwNvE5

name: NPR
text: Muslims in China now fear that religious freedoms are regressing to those in the days of the Cultural Revolution, a decade of severe political and religious persecution in the 1960s and 1970s. https://t.co/CSQtF2YplS

name: NPR
text:
Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine candidate has to be kept very, very cold — colder than winter in Antarctica. That presents some challenges for distribution.

Here's how communities are working to solve for this, and how the new Moderna vaccine could help. https://t.co/hORXm6ZSM0

name: NPR
text: More than 50 years after “Alice's Restaurant” hit the airwaves — its namesake has fallen on hard times. (@WBUR) https://t.co/acKm0dAt1z

name: NPR
text: Many people feel they have less social support from friends and family now than before the pandemic. For some, their pets have played a critical role in helping to reduce depression, anxiety, isolation and loneliness, according to recent surveys. https://t.co/NSPsSLTtLe

name: NPR
text: While some fitness studios and indoor sports facilities are rolling out coronavirus safety plans that include upgraded air filtration systems and meticulous cleaning, our experts say this isn't enough to keep you safe from infection. https://t.co/3Prm2H5g2o
